org.jcvi.jillion.trace.chromat

Interface Chromatogram

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Trace
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AbiChromatogram, ScfChromatogram, ZtrChromatogram
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicChromatogram, ScfChromatogramImpl, ZTRChromatogramImpl

    public interface Chromatogram
extends Trace
    Chromatogram is an interface for SangerTrace objects that also contains ChannelGroup data and optional comments generated from the sequencing machine.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ChannelGroup getChannelGroup()
      Get the ChannelGroup of this Chroamtogram.
      Map<String,String> getComments()
      Get the key-value pair comments associated with this chromatogram.
      int getNumberOfTracePositions()
      Get the number of actual trace scan positions in the trace file.
      PositionSequence getPeakSequence()
      Get the PositionSequence of the peak positions from the trace scan positions in the trace file.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jcvi.jillion.trace.Trace

        getId, getLength, getNucleotideSequence, getQualitySequence

    • Method Detail

      • getPeakSequence

        PositionSequence getPeakSequence()
        Get the PositionSequence of the peak positions from the trace scan positions in the trace file. The peaks are the positions that the basecaller determined are the scan points positions that are likely to be the bases.
        Returns:
        a PositionSequence; will never be null.

      • getNumberOfTracePositions

        int getNumberOfTracePositions()
        Get the number of actual trace scan positions in the trace file. Most Sanger Trace files have about 15,000 trace points.
        Returns:
        the number of trace position in this chromatogram.

      • getChannelGroup

        ChannelGroup getChannelGroup()
        Get the ChannelGroup of this Chroamtogram.
        Returns:
        a ChannelGroup, never null.

      • getComments

        Map<String,String> getComments()
        Get the key-value pair comments associated with this chromatogram.
        Returns:
        a Map of comments by key, may be empty but will never be null.
